website_summaries.verdict: Great size and construction of grow bags that will yield strong performance.
pros: Grow bags that feature multiple sizes from 1 to 15 gallons, making them great for all kinds of situations
Container has an aerated fabric, which ensures your plants can receive the air flow they need to thrive
Great value with 5 grow bags in the set
Tough handles make bags easy to move
cons: Bags will leak a lot of water
Fabric is very thin and may not last over time

customer_reviews.title: Shallow and wide 5gal fabric pot
customer_reviews.text: These 5 gallon grow bags have worked just as well as other brands. The thing I found different about these as compared to many others are that they are more shallow and wide instead of being deep and narrow. As far as performance, I found them better than the grow sun brand. They don’t let the water just flow straight through the fabric. It gives the plant a chance to soak up the water instead of it just pouring out the side when it hits some dirt.
customer_reviews.author: WillyJayTop Contributor: Hydroponics

customer_reviews.title: Good material small size
customer_reviews.text: These seem smaller then the size it states. I bought the 7 gallon bags and I tried placing a 5.5 gallon container in it just to see if it was bigger and container wouldn't fit. Bags are good material I just advise you to buy bigger then what you think you may need. So if you want a 5 buy 7, if 7 buy 10 gallon.
customer_reviews.author: JTRONIKS PC

customer_reviews.title: Great for growing vegetables
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for lady/gentleman farmers with small areas to farm. I only wish that saucers were provided with them, even knowing the price would be increased. Using them without saucers is impossible because water runs out before you can totally hydrate the soil. I purchased saucers at Lowe's that fit the bags perfectly. I should add that the bags arrived ahead of the anticipaed time and in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Beausmum

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product!  Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these potting bags. Have always had a garden. Now live somewhere with no backyard. These Grow Bags are SO much better than using the plastic pots! I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Will definitely use again
customer_reviews.text: I used these for my tomato plants this year, where I live in an apartment and need to do container gardening, and I've never had container tomatoes end up so big! My plants were healthier and larger than they've ever been before. I'm so pleased! They do dry out faster than plastic pots, so you have to stay on top of watering and can't afford to be lazy!
customer_reviews.author: AI

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and easy to use. Needs a lot of soil, but light to carry. I added a stiff piece of styrofoam to the inside bottom because I move my plants to maximize all sides of plant to spend time in full light. So far, no ruined roots from moving bag.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Gardener In Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: A deeper depth would have been better
customer_reviews.text: These will suffice for some plants that do not root deeply (e.g. tomatoes) but for ones that do root deeper. I was somewhat disappointed at the depth of these pouches at only 12" I wanted these for plants with a much deeper rooting system, but having said that, the bag is strong enough to support smaller plants with the drainage being good enough as long as you place it on a surface that will allow excess water to drain.
customer_reviews.author: David Edwards and Tina Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great product, as others have commented
customer_reviews.text: Great product, as others have commented, buy the next size larger, I wanted 5 gal so I bought 7 gal., Just the right size for portability. Note plants can breath better but they do dry out quicker, use a 12" PP round plastic tray underneath to conserve water. Mid summer I have to water every two days. Can't wait to see if I can reuse another season. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Oh man, where to begin... i ordered these at the beginning of May; finally showed up half way through July. I ordered black bags and tan ones showed up. I tried to get a return because they took so long and the shipping/tracking info they provided just came up as "pending/does not exist". Bags seems incredibly thin and are the wrong color. Do not buy unless you're looking for subpar Chinese products that take forever to ship and do not match descriptions/expectations.
customer_reviews.author: M. S.

customer_reviews.title: Growing healthy plant in my patio
customer_reviews.text: First time ever I'm using these growing bags, I have some tomatoes that I planted from seeds, I transferred to these bags, and it amazingly growing so healthy and green and beautiful, I bought the second set, but smaller since now I'm in love with results. Thanks , I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Adabh

customer_reviews.title: These planting containers are a brilliant concept. However
customer_reviews.text: These planting containers are a brilliant concept. However, where I am located it is extremely dry, with frequent high winds so the plants I have in them--tomatoes, bell peppers, dry out almost immediately. For someone living in a different climate, they will probably work much better. I ordered them so that I could easily store them when the planting season is over.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bottino

customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Work great with the small tomato cages. Great price. Will probably be able to get two years use of the bags. Not as thick as some, but not nearly as expensive either. Great product.

customer_reviews.title: 20 gallon is perfect size for young trees!
customer_reviews.text: 20 gallon is perfect size for young trees! Very easy to move them to permanent hole when ready. Retain their shape well, and bottom is easy to cut out if you want to in a few months.

customer_reviews.text: These “10” gallon bags are actually 5 gallon. I ordered actual 10 gallon grow bags from 2 different companies. They are, obviously, twice as big.

customer_reviews.title: Better Options Available
customer_reviews.text: This is a very thin weaved fabric pot. I will be surprised if I get two grows from each bag. There are better options on the market.

customer_reviews.title: No where close to the size I paid for....  WAY TOO SMALL!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed about the size that I purchased.... I bought two 5 packs of the 20 gallon grow bags, so I could grow potatoes. But they definitely are no where close to 20 gallons! Here are some pictures of it with a 5 gallon pail. Unhappy that I spent money on something that is not what it is labeled as.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica F.

customer_reviews.title: Not all they are cracked up to be, waterproofing and a drain is a must. Use 14" high saucers, 12" will not work at all.
customer_reviews.text: These are okay "Smart Grow Bags", but you best plan on using kids swimming pools because they leak like crazy. I'd suggest waterproofing a boxed-in area with pond liner. You will need at least 14" plant saucers as well or a way to drain the overflow. (Plants like to be flushed anyhow, build a drain in the center, but be sure it's 100% waterproof)
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: I use them to grow tomatoes in Florida - a large cage fits nicely in them along with a tall tomato stake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Grow Bags, Fabric Planter, 5-Pack 10 Gallon Plantmate Flower Plant Hydroponic Aeration Fabric Pot Container with Handles (Black)
product_meta.description:
Size:10 Gallons| Color:BlackHealthy roots are the fundamental key to a bigger and better plant. Fabric grow bags are the most advanced vessels to house your budding plants and flowers, as they are an immeasurable boon to your roots as opposed to hard containers.



 * Breathable fabric provides excellent aeration for roots.
 * Aeration allows your soil to drain better, preventing over-watering issues.
 * Aeration also allows excess heat to escape the soil better on hot days.
 * When roots touch the fabric of a grow bag, they will entangle and promote side branching, allowing a beneficial root structure. Roots inside a hard container will circle and harmfully constrict over time.
 * Roots are air pruned when exposed in the air through the fabric, promoting your plant to continue producing new and healthy branching roots even over longer periods.
 * Healthier roots will overall produce bigger plants with more flowers and fruits as well as increased insect and disease resistance.
feature_bullets: Aeration: Breathable fabric grow bag allows aeration for your roots and allows soil to cool better on hot days.
Healthy Roots: Fabric prevents harmful root circling and promotes healthy root pruning.
Easy Relocation: Handles make for safe and easy transportation when your plant is ready for transplant.
Convenient: Can be used for both indoor and outdoor grow. Inexpensive to replace, choose from multiple sizes for any container size you require.
NOTE: Aerated fabric allows your soil to drain better, preventing over-watering issues, be wary however, as it may also cause soil to dry faster than expected.
